11 SSI governance frameworks

by Drummond Reed

Self-sovereign identity (SSI) is a cutting edge technology movement and SSI governance frameworks are at the cutting edge of SSI. As a result, there are still relatively few governance frameworks in production as examples to which we can point. However, many in the SSI community believe they will be a crucial part of SSI’s success. Our co-author Drummond Reed is one of the leading proponents of governance frameworks. He has co-chaired the Sovrin Governance Framework Working Group since 2016 and is a co-founder of the Trust over IP Foundation (ToIP) where he co-chairs the Governance Stack Working Group. These groups and others are focused on developing this aspect of SSI architecture. This chapter will use the ToIP stack and other initiatives in the space to explain how different governance frameworks are relevant to each layer of the stack. This subject will undoubtedly evolve over time; our aim is to provide a starting point for anyone who wants to explore and/or contribute to this area.

In chapter 2 we introduced the basic concept of the governance framework as a core building block of self-sovereign identity (SSI) architecture. In this chapter we’ll go much deeper into the special role governance frameworks play in fusing SSI technology with the realities of business, law, and society.
